question.questionText: Wendy is making an electromagnet. She wrapped a long, insulated wire around an iron nail. What should Wendy do next to complete the electromagnet?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Wendy should hook one end of the wire to the negative side of a D-cell battery and the other end to the positive side of the D-cell battery.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: She would put and back it to a D-cell.
Stick it into the clips and close the switch.
She should hook the extra wire from the wrapping part and connect the wires to the switch and D-cell battery. Then stick a short wire to connect the D-cell and switch.
Wendy will connect the wire to a D-cell battery and switch, switch optional.
She should hook it to a D-cell.
Hook the wires to the power source.
Connect it to a battery and a switch.
Connect one of the tips of the long wire to the switch. Connect the other long end of the wire to the D-cell and connect the short wire to the D-cell and the switch.
Hook the wire to a D-cell. Get a switch and another wire hook that wire to the switch. Get something made of metal. Press the top of the nail to the metal thing, they should stick.
Get another wire hook it with the D-cell and the switch get the insulated wire and hook it to the switch and D-cell then turn it on with the switch and there a electromagnet.
Get a D-cell and a switch, connect the insulated wire to the switch and battery and you have an electromagnet.
She should see if the magnet works as a electromagnet.
She should get a D-cell to make it work.
Put the wires to the D-cell.
Attach the wire to each end of the nail.
She should hook the wire to the D-cell and switch and see if it will pick up iron or steel.
Wendy, you should have a D-cell or a D-cell it does not matter. And a switch if you want it to work.
Get a D-cell and a switch.

Wendy can hook one side of the wire to a switch, and the other side of the wire to the negative side of the D-cell after that get another small wire and hook that to the positive side of the D-cell and to the top of the switch.
She should attach one wire to a D-cell and the other to a switch. Then, she connects the D-cell and switch with a wire.

Wendy should get a D-cell and hook it up to the insulated wire and get a switch and hook some wires up to that, then she should get little washers and put them somewhere. Then you have an electromagnet.
Wendy should connect all the wires then to see if it works Wendy can try to pick up some washers.
Wendy should connect the insulated wire to a D-cell and a switch and that will be a complete circuit and it will attract iron or steel.
She should attach a switch to one side of the wire and attach the other to the D-cell. Attach another wire to the D-cell and switch.
Connect the wire to a D-cell and connect the wire to a switch and turn it on.
Wendy should plug in the electromagnet.
Wendy will get a battery and connect the wires to the battery, get a battery holder.
Connect it to a battery.
Then Wendy should get another piece of wire and wrap it around the nail also then connect the other end of the wire to a negative and a positive.
Hook the wires to both sides of a battery.
She needs a D-cell and washers.
Wendy should connect the long wire to the battery next.
Wendy needs to get little washers and stick the iron to the washer.
She would need a switch then she would turn on the switch she would also need a D-cell.
Connect the wire to the D-cell and turn it on.
She needs a D-cell to make it run.
Connect the wires to a battery or power source.
Hook it up to the D-cell then to the stick.
To complete the circuit she needs to connect both ends of the wire to both end of a D-cell. You can use a switch.
